item.title: CCSCV2025 FOR NOSTALGIAS
item.description:
FORENSICS CSCV WRITEUP 2025 From: MTA.Support

FOR2: NostalgiaS

First, after extract the file zip with the password provided by admin, we have file challenge.ad1 and we need to open it in FTK Imager

Remember the user who was hacked name kadoyat, so we go to get information in users/kadoyat

Look around for important files like documents, downloads, desktop but there are no any information there so that we need to navigate to find out from his web history

item.title: CSCV 2025 Final Attack-Defense
item.description:
• CSCV 2025 Final Attack-Defense
    • Daemon Pwn01
    • Daemon Pwn03

After 8 hours of Attack‚ÄìDefense competition, MTA.ADC finished within the Top 4 strongest teams and achieved 3rd place overall.

Daemon Pwn01

Challenge directory structure:

1. Introduction

The challenge provides a binary simulating a file manager that allows registration, login, and basic file operations.

The main vulnerability lies in how the program prints file content, resulting in a Format String bug that allows overwriting the Global Offset Table (GOT) and taking control of the program.

item.title: CSCV2025 - Pwn
item.description:
CSCV2025 - Pwn

RacehorseS

Summary

Sources: horse_say.zip

The binary contains a format-string vulnerability in printf(s) and Partial RELRO. Use a format-string to overwrite GOT entries. The goal is to get a shell by redirecting strlen() to system() and passing "/bin/sh".

Exploit

Allow multiple inputs

int __fastcall main(int argc, const char **argv, const char **envp)
{
  unsigned __int64 i; // [rsp+10h] [rbp-430h]
  unsigned __int64 j; // [rsp+18h] [rbp-428h]
  size_t v6; // [rsp+20h] [rbp-420h]
  size_t v7; // [rsp+28h] [rbp-418h]
  char s[1032]; // [rsp+30h] [rbp-410h] BYREF
  unsigned __int64 v9; // [rsp+438h] [rbp-8h]

  v9 = __readfsqword(0x28u);
  setup(argc, argv, envp);
  memset(s, 0, 0x400u);
  printf("Say something: ");
  if ( fgets(s, 1024, stdin) )
  {
    v6 = strlen(s);
    if ( v6 && s[v6 - 1] == 10 )
      s[v6 - 1] = 0;
    v7 = strlen(s);
    if ( !v7 )
      strcpy(s, "(silence)");
    putchar(32);
    for ( i = 0; i < v7 + 2; ++i )
      putchar(95);
    printf("\n< ");
    printf(s);
    puts(" >");
    for ( j = 0; j < v7 + 2; ++j )
      putchar(45);
    putchar(10);
    puts("        \\   ^__^");
    puts("         \\  (oo)\\_______");
    puts("            (__)\\       )\\/\\");
    puts("                ||-----||");
    puts("                ||     ||");
    puts(&byte_402096);
    exit(0);
  }
  return 0;
}

item.title: CSCV2025 FOR CASEALPHAS
item.description:
FORENSICS CSCV 2025 from: MTA.SUPPORT

FOR3: CASE ALPHAS

First, we have the file zip from admin, then we enter the password to extract this

After extracted, we got 2 files

Open ReadMe.pdf to read the information and get the password to extract file zip

Open evidences, there is 3 file, we just need to care about evidences.ad1 first

Open it in FTK Imager:

Fortunately, after a quick scan, notice that the insider threat has downloaded chatgpt desktop and simplenote, so that we need to check file .db in 2 files

item.title: CSCV2025 FOR COVERTS
item.description:
FORENSICS CSCV2025 WRITEUP From: MTA.Support

FOR4: CovertS

First, we have the file and the password provided admin, after extract the file, we have file challenge.pcapng

Open file, because this file contain 1GB of data, so that we need to predict what protocol is suspicious and start to filter around this

Because the hacker exfiltrated sth, to reduce the possibility of being detected, we often have to split files and data to smaller pieces, so we will need a lot of packets. From there, we can eliminate some protocols such as NTP, ARP, HTTP, UDP

item.title: CSCV2025 FOR DNS
item.description:
FORENSICS CSCV 2025 WRITE UP From: MTA.Support

FOR1: DNS

After downloading and unzipping the file, we will get the following 3 files

  • capture.pcap
  • access.log
  • error.log

First open the .pcap file with wireshark and get the following interface

Rearrange the section information and scroll from top to bottom

We find the suspicious dns with information ending in hex.cloudflar3.com

Get the query response, we has:

p.3dfec8a22cde4db4463db2c35742062a415441f526daecb59b.hex.cloudflar3.com p.c7aec5d0d81ba8748acac6931e5add6c24b635181443d0b9d2.hex.cloudflar3.com p.f6af1ecb8cc9827a259401e850e5e07fdc3c1137f1.hex.cloudflar3.com p.f8aad90d5fc7774c1e7ee451e755831cd02bfaac3204aed8a4.hex.cloudflar3.com f.6837abc6655c12c454abe0ca85a596e98473172829581235dd.hex.cloudflar3.com f.95380b06bf6dd06b89118b0003ea044700a5f2c4c106c3.hex.cloudflar3.com

item.title: PACKAGES
item.description:
PACKAGES

https://packages.challs.pwnoh.io/

Ph√¢n t√≠ch source

main.py

distro  = request.args.get("distro", "").strip().lower()
package = request.args.get("package", "").strip().lower()

sql = "SELECT distro, distro_version, package, package_version FROM packages"
if distro or package:
    sql += " WHERE "
if distro:
    sql += f"LOWER(distro) = {json.dumps(distro)}"
if distro and package:
    sql += " AND "
if package:
    sql += f"LOWER(package) = {json.dumps(package)}"
sql += " ORDER BY distro, distro_version, package"

print(sql)
results = db.execute(sql).fetchall()
  • author d√πng json.dump ƒë·ªÉ quote tham s·ªë ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng khi gh√©p chu·ªói SQL

Gi·∫£i th√≠ch v·ªÅ json.dump trong python json.dump ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ƒë·ªÉ serialize m·ªôt object python (vd: dictionary, list, tuple, string, int, float, bool, , None) th√†nh ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng JSON v√† vi·∫øt tr·ª±c ti·∫øp v√†o m·ªôt file ho·∫∑c file-like object. module: c·∫ßn import json ƒë·ªÉ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng

item.title: PortfolioS
item.description:
PortfolioS

Challenge file: public.zip

1) Ph√¢n t√≠ch challenge

1.1 Ki·∫øn tr√∫c (Docker Compose + m·∫°ng)

  • H·ªá th·ªëng c√≥ 2 service:
    • app: Spring Boot (Tomcat embedded)
    • nginx: reverse proxy expose c·ªïng 8989 ra host, proxy_pass http://app:8989.
    • M·ªçi truy c·∫≠p t·ª´ ngo√†i ƒëi qua nginx r·ªìi m·ªõi t·ªõi app.

1.2 Nginx ch·∫∑n exact-match

location = /internal/testConnection { return 403; }
location / { proxy_pass http://app:8989; }
  • D√πng exact match (=) ‚Üí ch·ªâ ch·∫∑n ƒë√∫ng chu·ªói /internal/testConnection.
  • N·∫øu path c√≥ k√Ω t·ª± r√°c ·ªü cu·ªëi (vd: tab %09) th√¨ kh√¥ng match v√† b·ªã proxy v√†o backend.
  • Tomcat normalize URL ‚Üí tr·∫£ v·ªÅ ƒë∆∞·ªùng d·∫´n g·ªëc /internal/testConnection tr∆∞·ªõc khi v√†o Spring.

1.3 portfolio.war

  • Controller/route: /login, /register, /dashboard, /dashboard/save, /internal/testConnection.
  • application.properties: 
    spring.datasource.url=jdbc:h2:mem:ctfdb;DB_CLOSE_DELAY=-1
spring.datasource.driver-class-name=org.h2.Driver
server.port=8989
  • InternalController (r√∫t t·ª´ bytecode/strings + template):
    • Endpoint /internal/testConnection c√≥ l·ªó h·ªïng JDBC Injection v√¨ gh√©p tr·ª±c ti·∫øp username/password v√†o chu·ªói k·∫øt n·ªëi: 
      String fullUrl = baseUrl + "USER=" + username + ";PASSWORD=" + password + ";";
Connection conn = DriverManager.getConnection(fullUrl);
  • V√† x·ª≠ l√Ω l·ªói l·ªô th√¥ng tin: 
    catch (Exception e) {
model.addAttribute("error", "Connection failed: " + e.getMessage() + " | URL: " + fullUrl);
}

1.4 Dockerfile (gi·∫•u flag)

  • flag.txt ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·ªïi t√™n ng·∫´u nhi√™n: 
    RAND_NAME=$(tr -dc A-Za-z0-9 </dev/urandom | head -c 16)
mv /flag.txt "/${RAND_NAME}" && rm -f /flag.txt
  • N√™n ph·∫£i li·ªát k√™ / ƒë·ªÉ bi·∫øt t√™n file flag th·ª±c t·∫ø.

2) Ph√¢n t√≠ch l·ªó h·ªïng

L·ªói #1 ‚Äî Nginx Reverse Proxy Bypass

  • location = ch·ªâ ch·∫∑n chu·ªói y h·ªát.

item.title: Write-up CSCV2025 final FOR challenges
item.description:
CSCV2025-FINAL-WRITEUP

This is write up for challenge Another Day (Forensics) in CSCV2025 FINAL

From: MTA.SUPPORT (Military Technical Academy)

Hi everyone, last Sunday, I have done this Forensics challenge in Cybersecurity Contest Vietnam 2025 Final, so that today I want to share you the way to solve this challenge

  1. Analysis file

  • First, I download the file and unzip with the pass gave by author. After that, I get a challenge.ad1 file so that I gonna put it in a tool I really like, it is FTK Imager

item.title: Write-up CSCV2025 final REV challenges
item.description:
Hello everyone! After taking a short break, today I will continue by writing about some of the challenges I solved in CSCV2025 competition UwU !

1. BabyAPK

+ Decription:

+ Analyst: This challenge give us an apk file, Use Jadx-GUI to decompile this file and follow the path Source code\com\svattt.vn\MainActivity to get to the main logic:

item.title: Write-up for Chatbot CSCV2025
item.description:
Hello everyoneüíØ! Today i will tell you the way to solve the Chatbot challenge in CSCV2025

The question:

So at first you will have an file main like this below: Let open this file in DIE to see the information about this file: This is an ELF64 file and DIE has told us that this file have been packed with PyInstaller Let use IDA(in app use SHIFT+F12) to see strings of this file: Scroll down a little bit and you will see this: We see many file like Py_ so that means this file was built by python We will use pyinstxtrator.py to export the content of this file(point in the main file to open terminal) Type:

item.title: Write-up for Reverse Master CSCV2025
item.description:
Hello everyoneü´°! Today I will write a little bit about The Reverse Master challenge in CSCV2025. The question:

When we install the file we will have an apk file like this: Use jadx-gui to decompile this file,then open Source code/com/ctf.challenge and you will see Main Activity like this: Open that and you will see the code below:

package com.ctf.challenge;

import android.graphics.Color;
import android.os.Bundle;
import android.util.Log;
import android.view.View;
import android.view.ViewGroup;
import android.widget.Button;
import android.widget.LinearLayout;
import android.widget.TextView;
import androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity;
import com.google.android.material.textfield.TextInputEditText;
import com.google.android.material.textfield.TextInputLayout;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.net.InetSocketAddress;
import java.net.Socket;
import o.CountDownTimerC0176z3;
import o.F2;
import o.F3;
import o.RunnableC0154w;
import o.V4;

/* loaded from: classes.dex */
public final class MainActivity extends AppCompatActivity {
    public static final /* synthetic */ int b = 0;
    public final byte[] a = {66, 51, 122, 33, 86};

    static {
        try {
            System.loadLibrary("native-lib");
        } catch (UnsatisfiedLinkError e) {
            Log.e("CTF", "‚ùå Native lib failed: " + e.getMessage());
        }
    }

    public final native boolean checkSecondHalf(String str);

    public final native String getHint();

    public final void h(LinearLayout linearLayout, String str, String str2) {

You can find the first half of the flag with this XOR code from python:

item.title: Write-up REEZS
item.description:
Hello guysü§ó! today i will write about a REV challenge that met at the CSCV2025 that named:Reezs.

First when you install the file and extract the folder you will have an .exe file like this:
When you run that file, you will see an CMD that told you enter the flag: Since there were no clues at first, I typed some random input to see how the program executes. As expected, it shut down immediately.
Then I opened IDA and loaded the file to read the main function and understand the execution flow. In IDA View-A, the main function looks like this:

item.title: WRITEUP: AUTHMAN (BUCKEYE 2025)
item.description:
WRITEUP: AUTHMAN (BUCKEYE 2025)

Quick summary

  • ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt web app Flask nh·ªè

  • Flag n·∫±m ·ªü /auth, ƒë∆∞·ª£c b·∫£o v·ªá b·∫±ng HTTP Digest Auth

  • C√≥ m·ªôt API check d√πng Referer ƒë·ªÉ t·ª± g·ªçi l·∫°i ch√≠nh n√≥ ‚Üí ƒë√¢y l√† ch·ªó d·ªã nh·∫•t, ti·ªÅm nƒÉng SSRF + logic bug

C·∫•u tr√∫c file challenge

  • authman/app/__init__.py ‚Äì kh·ªüi t·∫°o Flask app, c·∫•u h√¨nh, HTTPDigestAuth
from flask import Flask
from flask_bootstrap import Bootstrap5
from flask_httpauth import HTTPDigestAuth
from config import FlaskConfig

app = Flask(__name__)
app.config.from_object(FlaskConfig)
bootstrap = Bootstrap5(app)

auth = HTTPDigestAuth()
@auth.get_password
def get_pw(uname):
	return app.config['AUTH_USERS'].get(uname,None)

from app import routes

  • authman/app/routes.py ‚Äì ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a c√°c route /, /auth, /api/check

item.title: ZC-1 CHALLENGE
item.description:
ZC-1 CHALLENGE

MTA_SUPPORT

challenge file: public

IDEA: Polyglot ZIP‚Üí7z + k√≠ch ho·∫°t qua ‚Äúhealth‚Äù n·ªôi b·ªô

M·ª•c ti√™u: Upload 1 file v∆∞·ª£t qua ki·ªÉm tra ZIP safety c·ªßa service 1 nh∆∞ng bu·ªôc service 2 gi·∫£i n√©n v√† ch·∫°y shell.php, r·ªìi d√πng endpoint health ƒë·ªÉ g·ªçi file n√†y ƒë·ªÉ l·∫•y flag CSCV2025{}.

Main idea: T·∫°o polyglot: nh√¨n nh∆∞ zip h·ª£p l·ªá v·ªõi zipfile (Service 1), nh∆∞ng l·∫°i ƒë∆∞·ª£c 7-Zip (Service 2) ƒë·ªçc nh∆∞ 7z ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i n√©n shell.php.
